description:
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires the provision and delivery of Electrical & Electronic Products to K Division located in Alberta as per the items listed at Annex "A" identified herein.

All the deliverables must be received on or before January 31, 2024 or best delivery date.

Basis of selection: A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all evaluation criteria to be declared responsive (compliant). The lowest priced responsive bid on an aggregate basis will be recommended for award of a contract.

Any supplier that wishes to obtain a supply arrangement for Electrical & Electronic Products may do so by responding to the Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) with the solicitation number E60HN-16ELEC on canadabuys.canada.ca.

full_summary:
# **Tender Notice: Electrical & Electronic Products**

## **Issuing Authority:**
Royal Canadian Mounted Police

## **Procurement Solicitation Number:**
M5000-24-1609-A

## **Notice Type:**
Request for Proposal (RFP) against Supply Arrangement

## **Closing Date:**
December 18, 2023, 3:00 PM (ET)

## **Expected Contract Start Date:**
January 31, 2024

## **Description:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites suppliers to submit a proposal for the provision and delivery of Electrical & Electronic Products to K Division, located in Alberta. The scope of work includes delivering products listed in Annex "A." All deliverables must be received on or before January 31, 2024, or best delivery date.

## **Selection Criteria:**
Bids must comply with the bid solicitation requirements and meet all evaluation criteria to be declared responsive (compliant). The lowest priced responsive bid will be recommended for award of a contract.

## **Supply Arrangement:**
Suppliers who wish to obtain a supply arrangement for Electrical & Electronic Products may do so by responding to the Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) with solicitation number E60HN-16ELEC on canadabuys.canada.ca.

## **Documents:**
Bid documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. Suppliers are advised to review the solicitation document carefully and to comply with all requirements.

## **Indigenous Procurement:**
The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for identifying Indigenous business capacity. Suppliers are encouraged to create a business profile in the IBD to increase visibility and potential business opportunities.

## **Bid Notification:**
Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders. Suppliers are responsible for regularly consulting GETS for the most up-to-date information.

Please refer to the tender description document for full details. The RCMP reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. [1]
